titleStmt.title: Mäṣḥafä nǝfq “Book of the Assistant Priest” / Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan “Prayer of Incense” / Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the donor, the King, and the Metropolitan; incipit of Text I and its subsections; Text II and its subsections; incipit of Text III; elements of punctuation; elements of Ethiopic numerals. In the incipit page of Text I, two lines are rubricated alternating with black lines (s. fol. 1r).

msItem.note: Text I presents a collection of passages excerpted from the Missal (the Mäṣḥafä qǝddase), which are read only by the assistant priest during the liturgy, as follows:
I-1) Excerpt from the Liturgy of Catechumen (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§ 22-25)
I-2) Excerpt from the Liturgy of Catechumen (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§ 41-44.)
I-3) Excerpt from the Liturgy of Catechumen (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§ 56-60).
I-4) Excerpt from the Liturgy of Catechumen (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§ 61-65).
I-5) Excerpt from the Liturgy of the Word (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§132-135).
I-6) Excerpt from the Acts of the Apostles, Acts 23:1-11, transcription of a monition from the Liturgy of the Word (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§ 148)
I-7) Excerpt from the Liturgy of the Word (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. III, §§194-209).
I-8) Excerpt from the Liturgy of the Word (MQ, Śǝrʿatä qǝddase, ch. IV, §§ 15-20).
I-9) Excerpt from the Liturgy of the Eucharist, Anaphora of the Apostles (MQ, Qǝddase zä-ḥawaryat, §§ 10-21).
I-10) Excerpt from the Liturgy of the Eucharist, Anaphora of the Apostles (MQ, Qǝddase zä-ḥawaryat, §§110-112).
I-11) Excerpt from the Liturgy of the Eucharist, Anaphora of the Apostles (MQ, Qǝddase zä-ḥawaryat, §§154-158).

Text II presents a collection of text mainly excerpted from the Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan “Prayer of Incense” (published in 1951 E.C. (1958 AD.) in Addis Ababa). With the exception of the beginning of the work, the sequence of texts is very close to the one of Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan “Prayer of offering incense”, present at the end of the Vatican edition of the Maṣḥafä säʿatat “horologium” (published in 1945 E.C. (1952 AD.) in Rome), on p.381-410. Here is the sequence of texts in Text II and their probable origin:
II-1) Prayer of Incense: excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 20-22.
II-2) Prayer of Incense: excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 123.
II-3) Supplication for offering the incense: excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 147.
II-4) Prayer of incense: Undefined.
II-5) Prayer of offering incense: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p. 383.
II-6) Prayer of Incense: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.383-384; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 131.
II-7) Monitions: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p. 384; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p.131-132.
II-8) Benediction: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p. 394; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 132.
II-9) Prayer for the hierarchy: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.394-395; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p.132-134.
II-10) Prayer of offering incense: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.395-396; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 131.
II-11) Prayer of incense: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.396-402; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p.137-142.
II-12) Prayer of Jeremy: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.402-403; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p.142-143.
II-13) Prayer for chrism and incense: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p. 403; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 152.
II-14) Prayer for request: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.403-404; similar but not identical to Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 143
II-15) Prayer for the dead: similar but not identical to Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p.143-144.
II-16) Prayer of incense - Prayer of thanksgiving: excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p. 404; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p. 146.
II-17) Prayer of thanksgiving : excerpt from Maṣḥafä säʿatat - Ṣalotä mäbaʾa ʿǝṭan, p.405-410; excerpt from Ṣalotä ʿǝṭan, p.147-152.

supportDesc.condition: Some folios damaged by rodents (e.g. fols. 16, 17, 26, 27, 30, 31). The sewing is damaged at the upper pair of sewing stations.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Careful. Black; red. Wäldä Muse.Wäldä Muse is mentioned as the scribe in supplication formula, fol. 30r, l.1Second half of 19th cent.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 1r: Simple uncoloured horizontal ornamental band.
Fol. 31r: Narrow coloured (black, red) horizontal ornamental band.

list.item:
Fol. 31r, l.7: Unclear note (exhortation to the priests?)Fol. 31r, l.7: [vac.] አጋምዮ፡[vac.] ልደ፡ ጊዮ[vac.] ያ። ወ[vac.] አንትሙ[vac.]፡ ፩አቡነ፡ ዘማያ[vac.]። ፈዓዓ።
Mention of ʾAgamyo church; possibly also of the donor Wäldä Giyorgis.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Holes close to the head (quire I).

origin.origDate: Mention of King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89) in fols. 7r, 17v, 20v and mention of Metropolitan Ṗeṭros (in tenure 1881-1917) in fols. 8r, 15v and 21v.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Wäldä Giyorgis (?) (s. Additio 1); Wäldä ʾAnanya (?) (s. fol. 12v, l. 14).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
